diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +40,44 @@	// scripts consuming the kubectl version output - but most of
	// these should be looking at gitVersion already anyways.)
	gitMajor = "1"  // major version, always numeric
	gitMinor = "8+" // minor version, numeric possibly followed by "+"

comments.body: this is gonna be stuck at a weird version forever?
Yes I couldn't decide whether to leave the 'already on the branch' version intact or revert it.  Either way, it will get overwritten via the lib/version.sh change.
maybe once we remove the "update files" logic from anago we can make a cleanup pass in the release branches to remove the bad versions here.

I suppose.  I would have much rather fixed this if this was an issue on the first pass. :-/
How strongly do you feel about it?  I'm still on the fence about it.
it's not a huge deal, but it might be a bit confusing if anyone actually looks at this file on the release branches.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +56,60 @@	// companion .gitattributes file containing 'export-subst' in this same
	// directory.  See also https://git-scm.com/docs/gitattributes
	gitVersion   string = "v1.7.11-beta.0+$Format:%h$"
	gitCommit    string = "$Format:%H$" // sha1 from git, output of $(git rev-parse HEAD)
	gitTreeState string = ""            // state of git tree, either "clean" or "dirty"

@@ -1,1 +37,41 @@	// TODO: Deprecate gitMajor and gitMinor, use only gitVersion instead.
	gitMajor     string = "1"              // major version, always numeric
	gitMinor     string = "0.0+"           // minor version, numeric possibly followed by "+"
	gitVersion   string = "v1.0.0-dev"     // version from git, output of $(git describe)
	gitCommit    string = ""               // sha1 from git, output of $(git rev-parse HEAD)
